intro: Cheiranthus sibiricus, commonly known as Siberian wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces bright yellow or orange flowers with four petals, which bloom in early spring. It has a fibrous root system and linear, grass-like leaves. Cheiranthus sibiricus is often found in alpine and arctic regions, where it thrives in cold climates.
